pullRequest.title: Change common sub-expression functions to return check flags and return result
pullRequest.bodyText:
The way we do common sub-expressions is to create 2 variables for each cse, 1 boolean flag to indicate whether the cse has been computed, another to store the computed results. So the logic for using cse is if(!computed) compute; return computed_result;. There are two ways to generate these:

wrap cse computation in a function, and when cse is used, check the flag, if flag is false, invoke function, otherwise load the result
wrap the flag check and computation in a function, which will return the result, so when cse is used, invoke the function.

We did some benchmarking with Facebook workload and found that approach 2 gives better performance. This is probably due to jit being able to better inline and predict the branch. Currently the implementation is approach 1, switching to approach 2 with this PR.

nodes.bodyText: When you are at it - is it feasible to make all these also fields instead of passing so many arguments?

commit.message: Change common sub-expression methods to return result
